review_title: A humanitarian organisation led by inhumane management
job_title: Marketing Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: HIV / AIDS care frontliners
cons: People are in power because of favouritism and not merit. Some upper management lacks basic knowledge about marketing and engage in outdated practices for decades. If you want to learn from the best and become an expert - this is not a place for you. I was going through constant toxicity and emotional abuse from my manager. He would "threaten" me that I could lose my job any minute, although my performance was great. He would take credit for any good work produced by me but when projects did not sit well with the upper management, he would put full blame on me and claim he had nothing to do with it. I got fired because he did not take responsibility and neither HR nor upper management investigated it how they should have. I had so much proof that he lied on me, I offered to show it twice, but they did not look at it. They have never given me any warnings, but chose to simply get rid of me because there was a personal issue, where my manager could not handle me getting any recognition. So be ready to kiss your coworkers' behinds and engage in activities that only make them look good, not what aids the company's mission.

review_title: Unique and Amazing GLOBAL non-profit Healthcare Co . Serving the  AIDS Community
job_title: Center Medical Director-AHF Healthcare Center in Miami, FL
pros: AHF has a unique business model and relies on it's own pharmacies, thrift stores, healthcare contracts, and other biz. entities for funding. 96 cents of every dollar from pharmacies and thrift stores goes back into the global mission of saving lives for those living w/ HIV. Massive global free testing, linkage into care, free condoms. In 45 countries, 16 states, Puerts Rico and Wash., D.C.. Over 1.5 million patients. Big into global advocacy w/ many opportunities to be involved in advocacy. Employees appreciated-bonuses, cola raises, decent benefits, $2500 CME funding annually, receptive management, strong IT department, electronic med records. Monthly CME via zoom-most meetings via telemed for different bureaus. Bigger domestic clinics comprehensive w/ lab/pharmacy, Ryan White Case MGMT on site. Pt lab portal. Phreesia patient log in system domestically. Offer primary care and hiv care on site.
cons: Electronic med. record (EMR) is CPS-would like quicker EMR. Lots of work, not enough administration time--(3.5 hrs / week)--meetings often w/in admin time. Currently w/ 20 min pt time slots unless new--then 40 min. During time of covid, not good if pt not early for appt. Would love to have more providers. Office, central, pt scheduled appt bookings-would prefer office booking only. Could use an LPN in addition to RN Manager and MA's at sites w/ over 1000 clients. Day after Thanksgiving needs to be a holiday.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Dallas, TX

Not all departments are the same, actually every department is better than working at the clinic.

review_title: Where's the stand on abortion rights?

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Overall a good mission and patients in need of compassionate care.
cons: Benefits and work environment could be SO much better for a "progressive" organization that makes millions of dollars in pharmaceutical sales and is purchasing costly real estate around Los Angeles and the world. You'll rarely (if ever) get a raise or promotion, UNPAID maternity leave (women are second tier), no real student loan repayment benefits (other than being eligible for PSLF), no options to work from home. Expect very archaic policies, poor management, and random Wizard of Oz emails from the CEO. Much of management should retire to allow for fresh and innovative ideas, but they will not because they get better salaries. There is no inclusion of employees for the overall cause - left in the dark about events; only certain men at the organization are included and promoted.

job_title: Property Management in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Every since I have begun my employment with AHF/HHF I have been welcomed with open arms. 
The staff is super friendly with a friendly working environment and have the understanding that it's "Patient First". 
Meaning so much goes into assisting the tenant while doing a wonderful job for the company. AHF/HHF also inform the Tenants that it is also "Independent Living", which I gather to believe that even as the company places the Tenant First the Tenant MUST still be independently incline to receive resources and assistance. 
This is a wonderful company to be employed for and I have recommended housing and employment to many individuals.

review_title: A toxic workplace if there ever was one.
job_title: Program Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
No doubt that there are aspects of the org doing some incredible work. The reach to do incredible work globally is there along with some people, in mid to low positions that are really incredible people. I still keep in touch with former co workers who have become great friends. 

There is a strong sense of camaraderie of people working hard for a great cause. The work AHF does has helped countless lives around the globe. While it faces backlash in America (mainly for its previous stances on PrEP), the global work of AHF has saved more lives and done more for people than most governments do.
cons:
Worth Noting: AHF has encouraged employees to post positive reviews here to raise the scores and counter negative feedback. 

Leadership. Michael Weinstein is a selfish, arrogant, and unhinged leader who has no issue demeaning people publicly as he sees fits. This is especially true of women and women of color. He does not value diversity nor diversity of thought. The closer you are with "MW" the more successful you will be. 

This toxic leadership style trickles down and allows other leaders in the org to demean the people who work under them. Those people are often working harder than the bosses they report to. The higher up you get, the less accountable you become. As a result, very few people are moved up. You would think is is congress with how much politics one has to deal with.

The mission of the org is excellent, no question or doubt, but leadership weaponizes this mission to justify under-paying people and over-working them. 

AHF has a massive problem with burn out.

review_title: IF you want  to  make  a  difference
job_title: Senior Program Manager in Washington, DC
pros: If you want to make a difference and work with an organization that supports the communities it serves, consider applying at AHF.  Here you will find leadership supporting your efforts, providing training, helping you grow.  You will be working where people speak out and challenge injustices and fight for what's right---whether it's a pharmaceutical company, the World Bank, China or whomever.  Here you will find,an organization that never hesitates to be on the front lines---be it HIV/AIDS, and other STDS, helping and caring for the peoples of Africa, in the fight against  Ebola, or helping and caring for the people of Haiti and Puerto Rico as they endure trying to recover from the ravages of hurricanes. During this COVID-19 crisis AHF has shown it cares for its staff and the community.  It was one of the first to send home and hopefully to safety, its most vunerable employees.  AHF has not closed its doors mor laid off staff.  It was one of the few that while quickly putting into place appropriate screening procedures to protect both staff and clients/patients made it known that we would see HIV positive patients of other providers if they were in need of medical care---without their provider needing to fear loss of their patient. Where communities are being challenged by gentrification and loosing affordable housing, AHF has pulled together resources and managed to provide clean, decent housing for some of the homeless.  We serve the community, we are a part of the community, and AHF supports the community.
cons: AHF constantly looks at evaluation and self-improvement.  The cons--if there-- WILL be worked on.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Dallas, TX
pros: helping patients save on meds that would otherwise bankrupt any one of us. Great outreach programs and events that employees can be involved with. Great benefits.
cons: First, your experience could be very different from the one I had but I want to let you know that this organization and the people in it, from managers to co-workers to the HR department, engage/condone/tolerate workplace mobbing, and the ones engaging in it go to psychologically disturbing lengths. So, if you can navigate an environment where you or someone you work with could be mobbed/bullied and still do your job, then take the job. If you can know that something like this goes on and you are still able to show up to work, do your job and watch your own back, then take the job. Because, I guess there are people working at AHF that manage to help their patients, so maybe you can do it too? I don’t know, people are different. But before you consider taking a job at this organization, get you a copy of Janice Harper’s book, Mobbed, and read you a few articles on the psychology of group think among other things, and then decide. This type of stuff doesn’t happen everywhere, and it’s NOT normal, so people need to know.

job_title: Staff Pharmacist in San Francisco, CA
pros: Mission goal:  underserved communities
cons:
No sense of human compassion from management or HR.  It's all about the metrics and micromanagement.  Pharmacy has, for the most part, been outsourced to centralized out of town / out of state facility in Los Angeles or Florida.  Most Dispensing and Clinical functions are no longer a function of the local pharmacy.  Doctors are not able to attend clinical education forums if they interfere with clinic hours even by a few minutes.  They are not able to keep a Doctor on staff.  Every minute / every conversation / every phone call is monitored.  Security cameras are reviewed constantly - Orwellian.  

A Dr note does not excuse a sick day.  If it's unscheduled x3 in 90 days you WILL be written up.  If you do call in sick you will be scrutinized why.
Every interaction with HR or Management is punitive (and cumulative) not restorative: Even if it had been many years since you've been written up - the next encounter is one step closer to being terminated.

Scheduled time off is easily canceled based on "the needs of the company." Requested time off is not approved on a timely fashion.  Shifts cannot be "traded" between staff members that both agree - schedule is set in stone despite family needs that pop up occasionally.

job_title: Front Office Clerk in South Florida, FL
pros: Working with AHF is not only beneficial, and rewarding everyday, but your surrounded by lots of support and guidance from everyone. It does not matter if you are the CEO, a Senior Director or a Front Office clerk. If you need anything there is always someone to turn to. AHF is not a regular workplace it is a family that cares for its patients and employees. During this difficult time with the outbreak of COVID-19, we recieved raises, no lay offs, and antibody testing so we can still work in the field. There is even a Employee Assistance Program. People are working from home effeciently and effectively. We were not left behind! We are taken care of and asked everyday if we are okay, and what do we need. We have personal protective equipment for employees and for our patients. I don't know of many places caring for us the way AHF has always done. There's so much more to say but words can't describe what it is like to work for such a great foundation and with many beyond great and diverse people.
cons: No Cons! There aren't enough hours in a day to get everything done but it gets done and that's all that matters!

review_title: AHF Rocks! Our purpose Fulfilled Daily - Service for All =}
job_title: Pharmacy Services Liaison (PSL
pros: I Love my job. (Almost 3 years now.) They listen to your concerns and suggestions & let you be you. I have the honor of being San Diego's First in-house delivery girl and was tasked with setting up our Personal Delivery service. It was an immediate hit with the patients & now there are 3 drivers (PSLs). During this time of Covid19 uncertainty & instability AHF has not only Not laid off staff, they also issued assistance checks at the end of March. Our location went into Quarantine as a precaution (No Positive tests)  and we have not lost any pay. Merit raises come as earned, Do your job well. We provide a Service, not a Favor! We have a nice holiday party, gift cards, bonuses...I take pride in being part of the AIDS Healthcare Foundation, a nonprofit Global organization. For Real! =)

job_title: Store Associate in Oakland, CA
pros: I work for Out of The Closet chain of thrift stores, under the AHF.  On a normal day-to-day basis, it's pretty cool: discover cool and fresh finds, talking to the everyday customers, cleaning up and making things pretty.  As with all retail, there are always issues with shoplifting and disruptions, but no more than any other store.  Basically, it's like most thrift places, but the reason I'm writing is what the store, and the AIDS Health Foundation by extension, is like when things AREN'T normal:  since the COVID-19 Health Crisis, my associates and I have been paid our full wages, along with an added bonus to keep us through for the next couple months.  In addition, we have all been guaranteed our jobs back once the crisis subsides, and there has been no layoffs as far as I know.   I have never received this type of care before in my years on the work force, and the fact that the AHF is committed to keeping everyone tells me all I need to know about their priorities. I will stick around for a lot while longer just because of this...
cons: A large amount of shoplifting, and little we can do to stop it.

review_title: Amazing Work We Accomplish Making A Difference Around The World
job_title: Associate Director in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: As an Aids Healthcare Foundation employee we are given the opportunity to make a difference in the communities we serve.  Aids Healthcare Foundation is patient centered and values its employee's. The pay structure, benefits and 401 K are great. Aids Healthcare Foundation has several divisions. I work in P Public Health Division Wellness Program  we are always busy and never a dull moment. We work closely with linkage and our Pharmacy division. I love our Advocacy Division and have been involved in many protests. Stand Against Hate, drug pricing and Healthy housing.  Aids Healthcare Foundation holds so many events, Pride, International condom day and my favorite Florida Aids walk. I can go on and on because I love what we do.
cons: With so many patients seeking services wait times is a challenge but were working on this daily. Technology is definitely improving our work flow.

review_title: A Company That Really Cares about it's Community
job_title: Out of the Closet Salesperson in Wilton Manors, FL
pros: This company takes care of it's employees as well as it takes care of it's Community! Their benefits includes a 401k plan that will matches your contributions up to $500 in the first year and matches up to $5.000 by the the fifth year, generous vacation and paid time off pay. As a thank you, they also give you store credits to use toward whatever you need from the store. The manager and assistant manager are very fair and drama free and because of that the customer's are also generally respectful and kind. Working for this store isn't just being part of a company that is making a huge difference in the H.I.V and A.I.D.S community, but it's also being part of a family and team that supports each other and cares. There is also a lot of room to move up and or around within the AHF company
cons: One of the cons that come with working for this company is the show of love from it's customers and it's managers by all the food they feed you. I'm exercising constantly now. Lol

job_title: Benefits Counselor in Lithonia, GA
pros: It's a paycheck. Hourly staff actually get along.
cons: This is literally the worst place i have ever worked. The stress levels are ridiculous. The turn over rate is through the roof. There are complaints of racism and poor treatment of staff constantly being placed to HR via hourly employees. Nothing happens to correct these issues. Staff members who have complained just continue to work and wait for a magical change. The Lithonia location is notoriously known for it's constant issues and high turnover rate. The expectations on employees are not realistic. This office operates like a walk in clinic. The patients have no boundaries or parameters. Expect to be talked to or treated however they feel. Their poor behavior is encouraged by the medical provider. This is seriously the most unprofessional establishment i have ever worked in. Do not waste your time. Patients will tell you how many individuals have been in your seat if you get hired.

job_title: Sales Representative in Jamaica, NY
pros: During this difficult time of COVID 19, administration went out of its way to protect patients and staff, made sure staff have lunch everyday, rides to work and anything they can do to make this process easier for a team that cares so much for so many! I have to extend a big thank you to Michael Weinstein, Donna Tempesta and Michael Camacho! We have had bonuses, no layoffs, grants for agencies who were hardest hit by COVID, PPE for all staff and affiliates, COVID updates and virtual huddles, ongoing constant delivery of meds for patients and uninterrupted medical services via telemedicine. I am so proud to work in a place that cares this much!! When so much is done for you, it's so much easier to do for others...the saying goes - to whom much is given, much is expected. WE are up for the challenge! Thank you AHF.
cons: This is a place that cares for people, if you don't care this is not the place for you!

review_title: Great place to work and make a difference.
job_title: in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Patients are the number one priority at AHF. Everything we do is for them and it’s so rewarding. The company also cares for their employees. 

This is a diverse company with opportunities to grow.

The company has several events through out the year to give back to their local communities and employees are welcome to volunteer. 

Health benefits are good, the company pays the majority of the premiums. 

During the COVID19 crisis, AHF offered free time off for those who were affected. They allowed employees to work from home. They also gave $500 to employees for COVID relief.
cons:
There is no paid time off for paternity or maternity leave. Instead you have to use vacation and sick time. 


You can be written up if you get sick and call out three times in 90 days. If you get sick you have to still go to work and risk getting everyone else sick. This doesn’t make sense for a healthcare organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: What a wonderful cause! This company hits it right on the head with their advocacy efforts, healthcare and prevention work. I worked there almost a decade and did grow a lot professionally. Most people do not agree with their president, however he is a man with great vision and drive.
cons: However, amongst taking care of the world when it comes to HIV, this company does not take care of their own. You are thrown into a bucket full of interoffice politics that is comparable to being on Capital Hill. I found that after I left it was difficult to find employment elsewhere because of the reputation this company has with others. People have expressed to me that they are weary of hiring someone who comes from this environment. Like I said most people do not agree with their president, however he is a man with great vision and drive, it's his leadership team that creates hell for others.

job_title: FOC/Benefits Counselor in San Juan, PR
pros: Aids Healthcare Foundation a truly honor to work for this company proudly serving those in need in our community. AHF is not just a company that offer a lot of benefits, but also for me is a platform to do what you really I love. I don't see it as a job I just come to do what I best know to do and it is helping others. On these uncertainly time this company has gone above and beyond not just that every week our CEO send us updates and saying how proud they are of our job, but from the beginning the company stated that there were not going to be layoff and also send a bonus of $500.00 dollars to those low income employees. AHF is leading this epidemic continuously serving our people our patients and showing them that we care, but also taking very seriously the safety and well being of our staff.
cons: I dont see any cons working for this company.

review_title: "Values Employees" is a joke, would give ZERO stars if possible
job_title: Head of Sales (Assistant Manager) in Columbus, OH
pros: Work environment in store was very fun and I met lots of friends for life working here. You meet a WIDE variety of customers, many of whom are awesome. Good perks in terms of discounts. My GM and coworkers were great. I truly did love this job, but being continuously overworked, underpaid, and disrespected was too much to bear after almost two years of working my a** off for this company.
cons: "Values Employees" is supposedly a core value of the company, but they obviously don't care about any of the OTC employees (especially trans, disabled, and POC employees). Also the Cost of Living raises are a joke and everyone is chronically underpaid. Thrift store employees are asked for so much physical and emotional labor for pennies, and yet the company still wonders why they can't keep a full staff. Additionally corporate was bad at communicating regarding events and promotions, and only responded to constructive criticism with pettiness and ableism. Overall AHF has lots of potential, but where they fail is in actually caring for their employees more than their paychecks.

job_title: Contracts Manager in Washington, DC
pros: I've been with AHF for going on 5 years and this is one of the most interesting (in a good way) and supportive environment that I've worked in. On a daily basis, I work with various departments and everyone is always willing to help. I've always had the mindset of treating employees right and they will ensure your clients are treated right. AHF takes care of their staff and I'm happy to see the results that roll out to our clients. We are still active in the current pandemic of COVID 19 and to top it off, we are dealing with racism that impacts people of color, in particular blacks/African Americans, to know that our president Michael Weinstein, supports his staff in their well being physically, financially and emotionally is comforting in a time such as this.
cons: I can't think of any negatives comments at this time.

job_title: Benefits Specialist in Newnan, GA
pros: Provide a clinic for people living with HIV/AIDS to come to.
cons:
I work ed for AHF for less than a year.  AHF took over my company.  I worked for the company they took over for over 1o years.  When AHF took over things changed.  AHF makes people think they are helping people living with HIV/AIDS but they are all about the money.  AHF would not exist without 340B funds which they use illegally.  They only apply for grants so they can get 340B funding.  
The benefits if you have a family are outrageous!!  God help if you are a single parent and have to cover your children.  You  can not afford it.  My insurance for myself and my children was almost 400.00 every 2 weeks!!  I could understand that a month but no it was every 2 weeks.

review_title: AHF Is There for Its Patients and Employees
job_title: Director of Operations in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
In my time at AHF, I've had the opportunity to participate in and lead many varied projects, proposals and operation expansions that would not be available in large healthcare organization, all of which have positively affected my career.  AHF advocates for its patients and works hard to provide the services they need.  AHF leadership backs its employees.   AHF was built on advocacy and fighting for what's right and during tough times, and the COVID-19 crisis is no different.  In times like this AHF shines.

During the COVID-19 pandemic emergency, AHF leadership has ensured no staff was laid off and provided for those who experienced personal hardship.  It's times like this when I greatly appreciate the company and its mission and management values.
cons: AHF has a unique culture that isn't for everybody.  Many staff flourish and thrive in its fast-paced and sometimes haphazard environment, and some do not.  AHF's public policy and agenda may not be for everybody.

job_title: Chief of Global Advocacy in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I have worked at AHF for 30 years - which have flown by. No other company compares in providing a road for growth and career advancement. Everyone gets a chance. If you want to work hard and make a difference in small ways and in big ways, there is room for you at AHF. It's a diverse team - top to bottom. I could not be more proud than to have devoted my career to saving improving and savings lives at AHF. There are many other places to work and to make a difference. But none compare. And our 1.4 million patients living today around the world would will concur.
cons: Sometimes it's challenging for many at AHF that we as an organization are sometimes misunderstood and our policy positions are not in consensus with other groups or leaders. But it's part of our role - to fight for what's right. So it's ok.

review_title: AHF is the place to be!
job_title: Medical Case Manager in Philadelphia, PA
pros: This is a great place to work at!  They are dedicated to helping HIV positive individuals regardless of ability to pay.   AHF lives up to their Core Values.   Great team mentality  and everyone has a can-do attitude.  This team mentality is across AHF Worldwide.  Good work/life balance with flexible hours.  You have opportunities for growth and your input counts at AHF.   Mr. Weinstein is a passionate leader that has made provisions for all staff in this pandemic.  There has been no layoffs within the company during this pandemic and management has been very supportive to staff  needs.    AHF definitely takes care of their staff with great incentives.  I have to give kudos to all AHF staff around the world!
cons: I can't think of any cons to working at AHF.

job_title: IT Department in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I've been at AHF for almost two years.  It's a big organization with a lot of moving parts and continues to grow rapidly which can sometimes be a challenge.  In IT, I have been lucky to interface with a lot of different departments.  Like any organization, they don't always get everything right, but Senior Management really does care about their employees and tries very hard to do the right thing.  Previously I worked for a company that all the owner cared about was how much money he made.  I feel here that in some small way, I am making a difference and actually helping make the world a better place, rather then making someone else rich.  During the COVID-19 crisis AHF announced there would be no layoffs.  I have many friends that are worried about their jobs, and for me this was very reassuring.
cons: Continue to improve on internal communications between departments

job_title: Associate Director in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I have been with the company for 10 years and it is the longest I have stayed in a company. I only not get to work with wonderful people but I get to serve the community. AHF is a company that you feel  you are family
cons: Every company will have cons but I don't consider this as hindrance with AHF. It is just part of daily life.

job_title: HIV Testing Counselor in Chicago, IL
pros: The executive leadership of the AIDS Healthcare Foundation has really stepped up during the COVID-19 crisis and taken care of its people. We received support in moving operations to working from home, they provided us with additional monetary support on top of our regular salary, and continue to keep us in the loop regarding COVID-19 and organizational changes.
cons: It has taken 3 months to receive access to healthcare benefits, which left me without coverage during these difficult times with COVID-19. For 3 months from your start date you should be prepared to not have medical coverage. The coverage options are also expensive, especially for lower-wage employees.

job_title: Communications & Marketing in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Fun office environment with decent pay and benefits.
cons:
- lack of direction, organization, prioritization and focus.
- too much time spent in unproductive meetings.
- Insecure job environment.

review_title: Company offers rewarding work and treats their employees well.
job_title: Computer Technician in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The company is a non-profit whose services makes the world a healthier, better place. One of our mottos is "Providing cutting edge medicine regardless of ability to pay." Most people, like myself, have to work in order to get the basic necessities in life. My previous jobs paid the bills and did not have much impact on improving humanity. Working here not only allows me to pay my bills, but more importantly, it  makes me feel good knowing I am helping others and contributing to mankind. Working around caring, like minded people here makes this a great workplace.  As one would imagine, we have a good medical benefits package and in today's times, that is a really big deal.
cons: No workplace is perfect, but I can't think of anything significant that I consider to be negative.

job_title: Anonymous in Atlanta, GA
pros: Company does care about saving and changing the lives of those living with HIV. Laid-back work environment.
cons: Poor planning from senior management. Employees seem to be hired/promoted based upon sexual orientation or HIV status not credentials and true qualifications. Mainly, 20% of the people does 80% of the work while most stand around and talk. Some employees manage to slide in under the radar with little accountability. One or two people work allday while others stand by offering no help or little solutions. Lastly, I work in an office where providers are judgemental and lack compassion.  I do not think Mr Weinstein is aware of the ethics (lack there of) in some centers.

review_title: Quality care, but lack of leadership and no room for growth
job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: AHF is the largest provider of for HIV/AIDS care internationally. That is what I love about working here - the patients and the opportunity to provide quality care.
cons: There's lack of leadership and support. They'd rather spend thousands on a lunch ordering gimmick to improve their image than on fit testing for N95 masks. They do not ask what healthcare staff "what would make you feel more safe" during the pandemic. The majority of medical management are out of practice or aren't medically trained. There's no room for growth.

job_title: Regional Director, Miami, Fl in Miami, FL
pros:
AHF commitment to serving others is extraordinary. I am proud to be part of an organization whose work in the field of public health is remarkable, helping the underserved, providing a voice to the unheard and assisting communities around the world so they can live healthier and better lives. 
One more time, now in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, AHF demonstrated how much employee’s dedication and service are valued and recognized. AHF rapidly adapted to take care of patients and staff, from providing financial assistance and ensuring no layoffs, to arranging remote work accommodations keeping employees informed and connected.
cons: There are no cons at this time

review_title: Gives A Real Sense of Fulfillment
job_title: Associate Director, Digital Marketing in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Knowing that your work makes a real difference gives that special sense of fulfillment that can be difficult to find in most places. The work and the environment at AHF feels just as competitive in developing your skills and experience as it does in any modern "corporate" organization but there's the opportunity here of literally seeing the real and direct positive impact your work with AHF has on the world, oftentimes right there in front of you, something that's not easy to find out there.

And the work itself can also be quite novel at times, which is great in keeping things fresh and exciting.
cons: The organization is very large in size and spread out geographically due to the nature of AHF's world mission. You may not be able to see the ends of it or meet everyone you work with.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Seattle, WA
pros: The best parts about working for AHF are the feeling of making an impact on the community through all the company does to help out our patients, whether that be through community events, the ability to provide service regardless of financial means of the pt or how we've continued to provide care to patients through Covid-19 without that even slowing us down. This company truly does care about the community and it shows in every aspect. It is great to be a part of something like this.
cons: The only real downside I can think of is pretty specific to my position. The current pharmacy software system has a lot to be improved on and can be very frustrating to work with on some days.

review_title: Not What I thought  it was!
job_title: Case Management in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Knowing that whatever position you are working for you are helping someone who really needs the help in living a better life after their diagnosis. The only thing.
cons: The workplace culture... it was as if everyone there had to fake a smile on their faces.  Shady management and no work life balance.  From the short time I’ve been there I could tell how quick people are filled with surprises. Not What I thought  it was. This company is big on advocacy, being a voice for the voiceless and standing up against Hate but the employees shown me otherwise. In the short time span I was there had been misunderstanding with a coworker ending with  the supervisor defending her . From that point on I realized this place lacked work morale no matter the situation. From then on, the next day I was terminated without any warning, write ups. ( Which went against their termination process)

review_title: The Best place on EARTH to work
job_title: Sales in Miami, FL
pros: This organizations allows for expansion of the work you were hired to do, as well as being able to freely voice  your thoughts and desires of the work yet to be done. Your creativity is widely encouraged.  The Grace and Love this organization shows its employees,  are remarkably different from other companies. Because of their mission " Cutting Edge Medicine regardless of ability to pay" allows you to work from your heart at a humanitarian level. Hopefully you will feel the robust joy of simply doing your job.
cons: I see no cons with this organization, that out weigh the cons of any other large organization

review_title: Nice Pharmacy to work for and Company cares about their employees
job_title: Pharmacy Manager in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: company provides adequate training in regards to completing your job; company provides quarterly performance incentives that really makes employees thrive to do their best; company provided $500 to some employees during pandemic to assist with their basic needs at home
cons: Need one in every every community

review_title: Proud to be a part of the AHF Family
job_title: Human Resources in Los Angeles, CA
pros: During this difficult time where we are all affected by COVID19, AHF has really done a spectacular job with communicating and providing regular updates to all employees. This communication has not only been initiated by AHF's CEO, but through  Senior Managers who have ensured that their staff is also taken care of. It is in moments like these where I am extra proud to be a part of AHF.
cons: None come to mind! AHF does what they can when issues arise and resolve them the in the best way possible.

job_title: HIV Counselor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I got to help a lot of people as an HIV Counselor. It's very gratifying to make a difference everyday.
cons: The company overall is very dysfunctional. The mission statement claims to "value employees" and that's simply not true. They kick people to the curb in a heartbeat, turnover is huge across the board. Employees walk on eggshells and morale is very low. It's all about the money and keeping AHF in the spotlight. They bully other agencies.

review_title: Way more positives than negatives have kept me working here for as long as I have.
job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Montebello, CA
pros: It is a not for profit organization who helps provide healthcare to a vulnerable and under represented population. Patient advocacy is very important to AHF as is providing HIV/AIDS care worldwide. During the current COVID-19 pandemic AHF management worked very hard to make sure all staff was safe and most were transferred to work from home. Management and IT was very effective with providing every staff member with the tools needed to continue to serve its clients.
cons: The patient to staff ratio can be high at times and this makes one feel like one can't keep up with caring for patients.

review_title: Perfect cross between non-profit and for profit organization
job_title: Pharmacy Outcomes Supervisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: AHF is very family friendly and for the most part treat their employees very well.  It is a very people-centered organization, whether it be patients or employees.  It is also great to know that the majority of your co-workers are there because they want to help others to the best of their abilities.  I feel great knowing that all my hard work and whatever $ I save the organization, go directly to patient care worldwide.  There are always possibilities to grow because the organization is constantly expanding.
cons: It is an ever growing organization.  Needs better structure/process to grow as painless as possible.

job_title: Director in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The commitment AHF shows to their patients extends to their staff. During the COVID-19 crisis,  AHF president assured staff there would be no lay-offs. In fact we received a COLA raise in the midst of all of it.  AHF respects the diversity, circumstances and uniqueness of all of their employees. It is a place where you can make a difference and have an impact for  the greater good. In return AHF stands by their staff and truly can make a difference in your own work and life.
cons: Keeping a work/life balance because it is easy to get caught up in your absolute impact on the patient's lives and the greater good, This is a place where what you do makes a difference in humanity.

job_title: Director in Bengaluru
pros: The commitment AHF shows to their patients extends to their staff. During the COVID-19 crisis,  AHF president assured staff there would be no lay-offs. In fact we received a COLA raise in the midst of all of it.  AHF respects the diversity, circumstances and uniqueness of all of their employees. It is a place where you can make a difference and have an impact for  the greater good. In return AHF stands by their staff and truly can make a difference in your own work and life.
cons: Keeping a work/life balance because it is easy to get caught up in your absolute impact on the patient's lives and the greater good, This is a place where what you do makes a difference in humanity.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: It is the most amazing company I have ever worked for.They work as a team, always ensuring the quality of care provided to the patient, improving the rights of workers with their particular needs and providing them with good compensation for the work done. One aspect that has become even more notorious in these times of pandemic, when many workplaces have laid off their workers, AHF, by contrast, supports all of its workers, provides free lunch every day, helps those who They have young children to work from home, and even in the midst of the crisis they employ new workers for new medical offices that have been built.
cons: I have no negative aspect to comment.

job_title: IT Analyst in Miami, FL
pros: If you value challenging work that is well positioned to assist the oft under-served communities within an evolving healthcare industry, then this is a great opportunity.
cons:
The work is very specific to both healthcare and assisting patients who are diagnosed as being HIV/AIDS Positive and also community STD outreach to the  to the under-served; this means that all of our patients are critically dependent with special needs healthcare not just when they arrive at a clinic, thus our responsibility to our patients is nearly always urgent.

A good fit at AHF will be someone who can foster New Challenge Mode, rather than stress; And one who can view "changes", as "process refinement".

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Los Angeles, CA
pros: AHF provides exceptional service to customers and you feel you make a difference in the community by being part of AHF. During this Covid-19 pandemic, AHF has gone above and beyond to provide and meet employee needs. They provided a small compensation to everyone to help economically as well as weekly lunches. They definitely made everyone feel how much they care for employees. Entire team is like a family, enjoy working for this company very much. Great Benefits and very flexible company, so many different departments and positions you can grow into.
cons: There is never downtime. There’s always different projects going on but all to benefit patients needs. If you like keeping busy and staying involve in patient care, this is where you want to be.

review_title: AHF Always Willing To Go ABOVE & BEYOND!
job_title: Director in New York, NY
pros: AHF has been an amazing organization to work for. Not only is the work we get to do so rewarding, the fact that senior leaders continue to think of the employees, and what they need, especially in the time of a global pandemic is phenomenal.
cons: At times, depending on various factors, focus will shift quickly, even if a ton of work has been put into an initiative, it has to be put down and energy redirected to another priority. This can at times be frustrating especially when it is team project that one person ends up bearing the brunt of the work.

job_title: HIV Counselor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: My role in particular is very full-filling spiritually and intellectually at times. It is a job where what you put is what you will get out of it.
cons: You can't always choose the people you work with and a clash of personalities, goals, values etc... happens frequently in a high paced, stressful environment like this one. This is in part due to the nature of this job and can't really be helped. So I advise that this job isn't an ideal for long term.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami, FL
pros: I had the opportunity to truly see the impact I was making. It was rewarding to truly impact clients and their retention in care.
cons: The pay is low and a lot of driving is involved. There's a lot you have to do and you may not receive a lot of helpful guidance. When I asked for help I was seen as incapable of doing the job. Additionally, you will be on call regularly therefore having a supportive boss and team truly is helpful.

job_title: Sales Associate/Cashier in Chennai
pros: The close "family-like quality" and setting developed with colleagues and administration is extraordinary. The mission and vision of AHF is incomparable. AHF not only cares deeply for their patients, but also values employees with constant support and efforts to maintain uplifted spirits and morale. AHF has been a first responder with Sierra Leone's Ebola epidemic and even aided Puerto Rico with generators to assist with devastating hurricane effects. They are currently helping tackle homelessness with their Healthy Housing concept, and it's unbelievable how hard AHF works to literally make the world a better place.
cons: It's unfortunate that more people don't know about AHF and all that they do for the world.

job_title: HIV Tester and Counselor in Chennai
pros: Management was willing to do more than just direct us to help the community, they also cared for us as individuals and took into account personal matters before we did anything. Open lines of communication at most times of the day allowed more than just a simple employer/employee trust to be built.
cons: The Houston team is small and still growing so there was a handful of times that time out in the  Mobile Testing Unit (van) was cut short in order to accommodate the free clinic that is run twice a week.

review_title: Great Place to work, what is missing a connection between departments that is needed to get the job done.
job_title: Maagement in Long Beach, CA
pros: People are very nice only headed in different directions to make a bigger difference in their goals.
cons: The lack of communication is tremendous. I think Senior Management should start being truthful with the wonderful CEO that they have and stop being scared to say what needs to be said. He only wants the best for all the patients.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Safety Harbor, FL
pros: Good pay, bonuses, reputable company, purpose-driven, provided lunch often :)
cons: Re: Safety Harbor, FL location-- new techs were made scapegoats, no sense of humor on the pharmacy side of clinic,  low morale, "constructive criticism" was destructive and hurtful, mgmt had little patience, lack of communication, not a "team" atmosphere, always ever present tension in the air.

job_title: Cashier in Los Angeles, CA
pros: irst of all I want to apologize that I do not speak good English. I want to thank the Founder: Michael Weinstein and everyone who contributes with their donations. And also to all the workers who, with their efforts, achieve the goals of our company, to help people living with HIV, homeless people like many others. Something that fills me with pride is that this foundation fights for equality and discrimination of races, religions, diversity of people. It focuses its resources on the most needy groups around the world. For all this I am proud to belong to such a family.
cons: I do not see any inconvenience

review_title: They got your back and then some
job_title: Pharmacy Tech in New York, NY
pros: I've been working here for about 8 yrs and it's been a great experience. This is a company that really cares about it's employees as long as you do what you're supposed to do which all companies expect. Pay is great and team work is expected.
cons: That we aren't in more states and locations around the world but that's hard to accomplish. I'd say personal time is often compromised.

review_title: Consistently mission-driven public health advocacy and services
job_title: Director in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The Senior Management, Board of Directors, Directors, Managers, and Staff share the unwavering commitment to AHF's mission to serve patients and advocate for public health. AHF's efforts span the HIV care continuum and target a variety of social determinants of health. The organization's large footprint across the United States and at the global level provide opportunities for staff at all levels to engage in a variety of public health efforts that target prevention, testing, treatment, and linkage to care. Driven individuals committed to public health services and advocacy will succeed at this organization.
cons: Like most nonprofits, internal politics and bureaucracy can sometimes hinder the organization's efforts. In addition, some front-facing staff positions experience high turnover.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Dedicated and highly motivated people are drawn to the company, but quickly realize that intelligence and hard work are simply not valued here.
cons: Michael Weinstein is the CEO/president who surrounds himself with frankly unqualified advisors who will never contradict his ideas.  He uses the mask of altruism to promote himself.  His favorite goal is not to bring quality healthcare to the underserved, but to be big,  The biggest.  And take credit for saving all those lives on billboards that brag about numbers AHF boasts to have saved.  It is no wonder that AHF has such a shockingly high employee turnover, and has had a mass exodus of HIV doctors.  AHF is widely disliked by the AIDS services community.   Weinstein is an embarrassment.

cons: None since I've began working 5 years ago.

review_title: Incredible team to be a part of!
job_title: Quality Assurance Specialist in Melville, NY
pros: I started working for AHF 3 years ago. All of my previous work experience until that point had been with small family owned “mom and pop” pharmacies. I was inspired by their mission and excited to be part of  a company that is doing so many amazing things for patients around the world. I was, however, also nervous to join a big corporation. Immediately, my fears were put to rest. AHF is truly unique in that they offer all of the benefits of working for a large company, i.e. benefits, amazing 401k, PTO, opportunity for growth etc., while still providing their employees with that “family” like atmosphere. The senior management is so incredibly approachable. They always have open ears and an open mind for suggestions from employees. They are not dismissive to the ideas of the “little fish” in the big pond, like myself. The past few weeks have further solidified my opinion of the organization. As the world is trying it’s best to navigate through these uncertain times during the COVID19 pandemic, AHF has truly shown their dedication to not only the wellbeing of their patients, but to their employees as well. From the beginning our senior management has “hit the ground running” to ensure that all patients continue to receive their medications on time, all patients have access to their AHF medical provider via the safest means possible and all of their staff is protected. All departments have come together to make this happen. They promised the employees from day one that there would be no layoffs and they have kept their word. They have increased bonuses for the staff who’s families may have been hit to hardest financially during the pandemic. They have done everything in their power to be able to provide us with PPE, which is no small feat. AHF has provided staff with safer work location alternatives for those who are at a higher risk. They have conducted leadership meeting every single day and implemented a COVID response team to get important and up to date information out to the staff in the most expedient way possible. They have spared no expense to put the welfare of their patients and employees first during these trying times. I could go on and on. I have been so humbled to be part of this team in which we have all come together in such an awe-inspiring way. THANK YOU AHF!
cons: I have not personally experienced any cons during my time here.

job_title: Regional Director in Baltimore, MD
pros: I've worked at AHF for almost 8 years. I started in an entry level position and now I am in regional management.  There is a lot of room for growth in the organization. And they are making strides to create more opportunities for employees. They truly value employees and have stood by us in times of national crisis. During COVID-19, no one was furloughed or laid off and the company even helped pay for sick leave for those impacted by COVID-19. They also provided financial assistance for all employees making less than $70,000.  I have never seen a more flexible employer. The organization itself values flexibility to meet the needs of the people we serve. It is so great to be an instrumental part of helping people get medication who couldn't get help any where else. In my 7,5 years, we have not rejected any one at any of our 4 healthcare centers for inability to pay or citizenship or residency or anything. It's truly remarkable the things that can be accomplished when the leadership of an organization just decides that's how they're going to do things. The company has grown tremendously in the last 5 years and added more support positions in leadership which has really helped pull the different regions together and given us a unified direction and brand.
cons: The only con is also a direct result of a pro. The company is growing very fast which is great because we are able to serve more people across the globe. But it can be difficult to manage that growth and maintain consistent quality measures. There also seems to be new leadership frequently that implements new initiatives or changes procedures and it creates a loss of efficiency. However, I have seen in the last year and a half to two years a true effort to add managerial support and create standards of operations to address the chaos that comes from rapid growth. I have also seen a new focus on improving employee benefits and salaries which used to be lacking. We are finally at a place where I feel each of my employees from all departments are compensated well and given opportunities for growth.

job_title: Regional Director in Baltimore, MD

review_title: If I were to sum up my overall experience with AHF in one word it would be IMPACTFUL.
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Miami, FL
pros: AHF values, recognizes and celebrates its employees for their dedication and service to their communities and beyond. In terms of culture, AHF welcomes people from ALL nationalities, cultures, religious affiliations, races and sexual orientations. In addition to their cutting edge HIV healthcare services they are #1 in their non-discriminatory practices. Upper management exhibits the upmost respect and dedication to their teams and ALWAYS makes themselves available. AHF is heavily involved within the communities they serve and graciously welcome their employees and families to partake in festivities, such as professional sports games, concerts, movie nights, galas and fundraising events.
cons: AHF is a global health organization specializing in HIV care and services. Additionally,  they are also the first line of defense to people during times of crisis. At such times AHF may call upon its employees to lend a helping hand and step up their game. Whether it’s donating clothes, food and building materials to aid people suffering from the aftermath of natural disasters or whether it’s asking people to band together in support of social injustices, AHF is front and center and reaches out to those they know and trust to join their efforts. If you’re willing to go that extra mile and to be that pillar of strength for some of the poorest and most underserved communities you’re in the right place. If not, then you may see this attribute as a con.

job_title: HIV Tester in Houston, TX

The HIV team falsifies numbers,  Mobile testing doesn’t work more than 3 hours a day on the mobile unit, and could care less about the client. Testing goals are approximately 600 per month. There is no time to find out why people are putting themselves at risk. The team is misinformed an out the use of universal precautions and are putting their clients and staff at risk for blood related infections.  Also, each client tested is a commission payment to the tester. So, each client tested isn’t even treated like a number, they are treated like another chunk added to the monthly paycheck.   Staff is not properly trained.  And management sees these problems, but does nothing to rectify the issues.  I do not recommend sending clients here for care.
